page.title: 01CHESSINGTON:TOWN OR COUNTRY?
page.content: On the very edge of built_up Greater London,{CHESSINGTON}has something of a split personality; the area has easy access to the metropolis (the A3 cuts through our section, & the{MOTSPUR {PARK BRANCHLINE}is the newest{BR}line in the national network) _ yet rural life is still a feature of modern Chessington. Until the 1930's, there was little in the neighbourhood beyond a remote village{(pop.150,1821 Census)}and a few outlying farms. Much of this aspect of Chessington remains, espe- cially in the south of our section. The enormous building programme which transformed N.Surrey between the wars saw massive development around here, with many families moving out from inner_city homes.{URBAN SPREAD} has now engulfed Hook & N.Chessington, making it contiguous with the capital.
